page.title: 17Pilsley Well Dressing
page.content:
Pilsley village fair and well dressing is held in the third week of July.
Prior to this the wooden supporting frame is soaked in water for three weeks. Clay is puddled to a paste, and pressed into the frame to form a base for the chosen design or picture. This is made by pressing into the clay petals, leaves, seeds etc. From this point the whole thing must be finished in three days but thanks to a willing team of local volunteers it is ready and erected on its' site in time.
A second well, dressed by the school children is nearby.
A thanksgiving service is held in the evening by the Vicar and attracts many visitors. The proceeds from the collections help many local charities.
